originalText: Although he was very tired but he decided to keep working because he don't want to fall behind. The weather was so hot, so I decided to not go outside, even though I had promised to meet my friend who is waited for me. She always have been interested in science, and her brother who is also liking physics encouraged her to study engineering. In the meeting yesterday, he say that he will finish the report by today, but he haven't send me anything yet. The book what I bought yesterday was very interesting, and I am plan to read more by same author.

sentenceFeedback.corrected: In the meeting yesterday, he said that he would finish the report by today, but he hasn't sent me anything yet.

errors.reason: Incorrect verb tense: 'say' should be past tense.
errors.improvedClause: he said that he would finish the report

errors.reason: Tense mismatch: 'will' should be 'would' to match past context.
errors.improvedClause: he said that he would finish the report by today

errors.reason: Incorrect verb form: 'haven't send' should be 'hasn't sent'.
errors.improvedClause: but he hasn't sent me anything yet

sentenceFeedback.original: The book what I bought yesterday was very interesting, and I am plan to read more by same author.
sentenceFeedback.corrected: The book that I bought yesterday was very interesting, and I plan to read more by the same author.

errors.reason: Incorrect relative pronoun: 'what' should be 'that'.

errors.reason: Incorrect verb form: 'am plan' is not correct.
